1â†’# Launch Control XL 3 Web UI - Development Workplan
     2â†’
     3â†’## ğŸ“‹ Project Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’A modern web application for creating, managing, and sharing custom modes for the Novation Launch Control XL 3 hardware controller. This application provides a visual editor, personal library management, and community catalog for custom modes.
     6â†’
     7â†’### Core Goals
     8â†’1. **Visual Mode Editor** - Intuitive drag-and-drop interface for creating custom modes
     9â†’2. **Personal Library** - Store and organize user's custom modes locally and in the cloud
    10â†’3. **Community Catalog** - Discover and share custom modes with other users
    11â†’4. **Live Device Integration** - Real-time preview and testing with connected hardware
    12â†’5. **Production Deployment** - Scalable, independently deployable web application
    13â†’
    14â†’### Key Constraints
    15â†’- **MUST** use the published `@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3` npm package
    16â†’- **MUST NOT** use relative imports to the core library module
    17â†’- **MUST** be deployable to production cloud platforms (Vercel, Netlify, etc.)
    18â†’- **MUST** maintain proper encapsulation for independent deployment
    19â†’
    20â†’## ğŸ›  Technology Stack
    21â†’
    22â†’### Frontend
    23â†’- **Framework**: Next.js 14 with App Router
    24â†’  - Server components for optimal performance
    25â†’  - Built-in API routes for backend functionality
    26â†’  - Excellent TypeScript support
    27â†’  - Production-ready with Vercel deployment
    28â†’
    29â†’- **UI Components**:
    30â†’  - React 18 with TypeScript
    31â†’  - Tailwind CSS for styling
    32â†’  - Radix UI for accessible components
    33â†’  - Framer Motion for animations
    34â†’
    35â†’- **State Management**:
    36â†’  - Zustand for global state
    37â†’  - React Query (TanStack Query) for server state
    38â†’  - Local storage for offline persistence
    39â†’
    40â†’### Backend
    41â†’- **API**: Next.js API Routes (serverless functions)
    42â†’- **Database**:
    43â†’  - PostgreSQL with Prisma ORM (production)
    44â†’  - SQLite for local development
    45â†’- **Authentication**: NextAuth.js with OAuth providers
    46â†’- **File Storage**: AWS S3 or Cloudflare R2 for mode files
    47â†’- **Cache**: Redis for session and API caching
    48â†’
    49â†’### Hardware Integration
    50â†’- **Package**: `@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3` from npm
    51â†’- **WebMIDI**: Direct browser MIDI access
    52â†’- **Fallback**: File export/import for offline use
    53â†’
    54â†’### Development & Deployment
    55â†’- **Package Manager**: pnpm (consistent with monorepo)
    56â†’- **Build Tool**: Next.js built-in (Turbopack)
    57â†’- **Testing**: Vitest + Playwright
    58â†’- **CI/CD**: GitHub Actions
    59â†’- **Hosting**: Vercel (primary) / Netlify (backup)
    60â†’- **Monitoring**: Sentry for error tracking
    61â†’

   183â†’## ğŸ¨ UI/UX Design
   184â†’
   185â†’### Key Views
   186â†’
   187â†’#### 1. Mode Editor
   188â†’- **Visual Controller**: SVG representation of Launch Control XL 3
   189â†’- **Control Properties Panel**: Configure CC, channel, range
   190â†’- **Drag & Drop Mapping**: Visual assignment of controls
   191â†’- **Live Preview**: Real-time testing with connected device
   192â†’- **Mode Settings**: Name, description, category, tags
   193â†’
   194â†’#### 2. User Library
   195â†’- **Grid/List View**: Toggle between layouts
   196â†’- **Folders**: Organize modes into categories
   197â†’- **Search & Filter**: Find modes quickly
   198â†’- **Batch Operations**: Export, delete, organize multiple modes
   199â†’- **Import/Export**: File-based mode management
   200â†’
   201â†’#### 3. Community Catalog
   202â†’- **Browse**: Featured, popular, recent modes
   203â†’- **Categories**: DAW-specific, instrument types, etc.
   204â†’- **Search**: Full-text search with filters
   205â†’- **Mode Details**: Preview, description, reviews
   206â†’- **Download & Rate**: Community interaction
   207â†’
   208â†’### Design System
   209â†’- **Colors**: Dark theme default with light mode option
   210â†’- **Typography**: Inter for UI, Monaco for code
   211â†’- **Components**: Consistent with Launch Control XL 3 aesthetic
   212â†’- **Responsive**: Mobile-friendly with progressive enhancement
   213â†’

   272â†’## ğŸ”Œ API Specifications
   273â†’
   274â†’### REST API Endpoints
   275â†’
   276â†’\```typescript
   277â†’// Authentication
   278â†’POST   /api/auth/login
   279â†’POST   /api/auth/logout
   280â†’GET    /api/auth/session
   281â†’
   282â†’// User Modes
   283â†’GET    /api/modes                 // List user's modes
   284â†’POST   /api/modes                 // Create new mode
   285â†’GET    /api/modes/:id            // Get specific mode
   286â†’PUT    /api/modes/:id            // Update mode
   287â†’DELETE /api/modes/:id            // Delete mode
   288â†’
   289â†’// Catalog
   290â†’GET    /api/catalog               // Browse public modes
   291â†’GET    /api/catalog/:id          // Get public mode details
   292â†’POST   /api/catalog/:id/download // Track download
   293â†’POST   /api/catalog/:id/like     // Like/unlike mode
   294â†’
   295â†’// User Profile
   296â†’GET    /api/users/:id            // Get public profile
   297â†’GET    /api/users/me             // Get current user
   298â†’PUT    /api/users/me             // Update profile
   299â†’\```
   300â†’
   301â†’### WebSocket Events (Future)
   302â†’\```typescript
   303â†’// Real-time collaboration
